labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on providing cryptocurrency market data and analysis. Its core functionality revolves around real-time price tracking, market insights, and historical performance of cryptocurrencies. The tools available suggest a strong emphasis on financial data, trading information, and market trends, which are essential for investors, traders, and analysts in the cryptocurrency space.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's tools and description directly relate to cryptocurrency market data and analysis, which are central to this category. The secondary labels "Data Analysis & Processing" and "Financial Services" were selected because the tools provide in-depth market analysis (data processing) and cater to financial decision-making (financial services) in the crypto domain.

tools.name: get-crypto-price
tools.description: Get current price and 24h stats for a cryptocurrency

tools.name: get-market-analysis
tools.description: Get detailed market analysis including top exchanges and volume distribution

tools.name: get-historical-analysis
tools.description: Get historical price analysis with customizable timeframe

interval.description: Time interval (m5, m15, m30, h1, h2, h6, h12, d1)

tools.name: get-crypto-price

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@truss44/mcp-crypto-price/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
